H0.text: The Sun is medium-sized compared to other stars.

H1.text: The Sun is the largest and brightest star in the universe, which best describes its size.

H2.text: Most of the stars in the universe would fit inside the Sun.

H3.text: Most of the stars in the universe are smaller than the Sun is the statement that best describes the size of the Sun.

A4.text: It is more massive than 95% of the stars within 7 pc (23 ly).

A5.text: It has an absolute magnitude of +4.83, estimated to be brighter than about 85% of the stars in the Milky Way, most of which are red dwarfs.

A6.text: The Sun is a mainâ€‘sequence G2V yellow dwarf of intermediate temperature and ordinary size.

A7.text: Most of the stars in the Milky Way are red dwarfs.
